channel.title: BBC News - Technology

item.title: Bella Thorne, OnlyFans and the battle over monetising content
item.description: Content creators say OnlyFans has slashed incomes by placing caps on prices charged on the platform.

item.title: Facebook threatens news sharing ban in Australia
item.description: The social media giant is preparing for a new law that would force it to pay publishers for news articles.

item.title: TikTok owner to 'strictly' obey China's tech takeover law
item.description: New rules mean Beijing could block the sale of the app's video recommendation engine.

item.title: Google-Facebook ditch plans to dock giant data cable in Hong Kong
item.description: The US government had expressed concerns that China might steal data carried by the cable.

item.title: Lee Jae-yong: Samsung heir faces fresh charges over 2015 merger
item.description: Lee Jae-yong faces new fraud charges, three years after being convicted of bribery and embezzlement.

item.title: Yegor Zhukov: Leading Russian opposition blogger beaten up
item.description: Yegor Zhukov, who is critical of President Putin, narrowly avoided prison last year.

item.title: Love Island stars and influencers paid to promote Test and Trace
item.description: Taxpayer money was used to pay influencers to promote Test and Trace.

item.title: Tesla Autopilot detects speed limits and green lights
item.description: The new update is available to drivers in the US with Autopilot activated.

item.title: Zoom profits double as revenues skyrocket
item.description: The popular video conferencing app has seen a 458% jump in customer growth compared with last year.

item.title: Neuralink: Elon Musk unveils pig with chip in its brain
item.description: Gertrude the pig is a prototype of a brain-to-machine interface.

item.title: Sir Isaac Newton's notes among Cambridge web gallery 'treasures'
item.description: Cambridge University Library adds high-resolution images of its collection to a free culture site.

item.title: Apple removes Fortnite developer Epic from App Store
item.description: The move is the latest in a row between Apple and Fortnite creator Epic over in-app payments.

item.title: Mini robo-surgeon performs mock surgery and other news
item.description: BBC Click’s Omar Mehtab looks at some of the best technology news stories of the week.

item.title: What’s behind the US’s proposed WeChat ban?
item.description: The billion user social networking app can also be used for shopping, gaming and other activities.

item.title: Plane built on Mumbai rooftop takes to the skies
item.description: No one believed pilot Amol Yadav when he told them his plans, but he proved them wrong.

item.title: Robo-chameleon tongue's high speed grab and other news
item.description: BBC Click’s Jen Copestake looks at some of the best technology news stories of the week.

item.title: Virtual time machine: ‘I can watch my life from 2019’
item.description: Lucas Rizzotto has built a "time machine" based on how he recorded life in 2019 with smart glasses.

item.title: Cloud gaming: Are game streaming services bad for the planet?
item.description: Remote streaming services may be the future but could cause a sharp rise in emissions, a study shows.

item.title: Rival powers jockey for the lead in hypersonic aircraft
item.description: The US, China and Russia are pouring money into aircraft that can fly at five times the speed of sound.

item.title: The search engine boss who wants to help us all plant trees
item.description: Christian Kroll is the boss of Ecosia, which donates 80% of its profits to tree-planting projects.

item.title: Seaweed: The food and fuel of the future?
item.description: The farming of seaweed is accelerating as firms exploit its fast growth and green credentials.

item.title: Why are clothing sizes so erratic and can they be fixed?
item.description: New apps use your phone to record your dimensions and recommend what size to buy at shops.
